comment.brief: The size of the source image, in points calculated with density, are used as the image size. This is the default: a 100x50 source image will be 100x50 points in size. This preserves size across various device densities.
comment.full: The size of the source image, in points calculated with density, are used as the image size. This is the default: a 100x50 source image will be 100x50 points in size. This preserves size across various device densities.

comment.brief: The size is pixel matched to the source so the image is drawn 1:1. This means the visual size changes across device densities, but the image remains sharp.
comment.full: The size is pixel matched to the source so the image is drawn 1:1. This means the visual size changes across device densities, but the image remains sharp.

comment.brief: If the size of the image in `PixelPrecise` mode is close to `PointPrecise` then use `PixelPrecise` mode, otherwise use `PointPrecise` mode. This retains sharpness with slightly varying sizes, but prevents too much size variation.
comment.full: If the size of the image in `PixelPrecise` mode is close to `PointPrecise` then use `PixelPrecise` mode, otherwise use `PointPrecise` mode. This retains sharpness with slightly varying sizes, but prevents too much size variation.

comment.brief: The image is stretched to fill the available space. The aspect ratio is not retained.
comment.full: The image is stretched to fill the available space. The aspect ratio is not retained.

comment.brief: The image is stretched in 9-segments defined by the `Scale9Margin`. Corners are not stretched, borders are stretced in one direction, the center is stretched in both directions.
comment.full: The image is stretched in 9-segments defined by the `Scale9Margin`. Corners are not stretched, borders are stretced in one direction, the center is stretched in both directions.

comment.brief: Stretches the image to touch the sides of the available space and retain the aspect ratio. This will result in unfilled sections on either the left/right or top/bottom sides of the image.
comment.full: Stretches the image to touch the sides of the available space and retain the aspect ratio. This will result in unfilled sections on either the left/right or top/bottom sides of the image.

comment.brief: Stretches an image to touch all sides of the available space and retain the aspect ratio. This will result in the image being clipped on the left/right or top/bottom.
comment.full: Stretches an image to touch all sides of the available space and retain the aspect ratio. This will result in the image being clipped on the left/right or top/bottom.

comment.brief: Specifies how the size of the image element is calculated and how the image is stretched inside it.
comment.full: Specifies how the size of the image element is calculated and how the image is stretched inside it.
